page.shortlink: api sql namespace result set object column number function
page.description: Get the number of the column named.
page.prototype: ColumnNumber as N = ColumNumber(Name as C)

argument.name: ColumnNumber
argument.description: The number of the column. The first column is 1.

argument.name: SQL::ResultSet
argument.description: A SQL::ResultSet object created with a DIM statement.

argument.name: Name
argument.description: The name of the field in the selected table.

page.discussion: The ColumnNumber() method returns the number of the named column. The SQL::ResultSet.Data() function uses column numbers to read data from a SQL::ResultSet.
page.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim rs as SQL::ResultSet dim connString as C dim select_exp as C connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v8\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" select_exp = "select * from customer where bill_state_region = 'ny'" if .not. conn.open(connString) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end end if if .not. conn.execute(select_exp) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) conn.close() end end if rs = conn.ResultSet rs.NextRow() ui_msg_box("Column Number", "" + rs.ColumnNumber("lastname")) conn.close()
